intro: Sonchus berteroanus, commonly known as the desert lettuce, is a flowering plant native to arid and semi-arid regions of the Americas. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads and serrated leaves. The plant typically grows to a height of 10–30 cm, with hairy stems and lobed, spoon-shaped leaves. Its yellow flowers bloom in clusters, and it is often found in disturbed soils or along roadsides. It is adapted to survive in dry conditions, with a deep root system and the ability to store water.
